meanings.definition: Fail to attain an intended or expected outcome.
meanings.sent1: She always fears that she will miscarries in her exams.
meanings.sent2: If you don't study, you may miscarries in achieving good grades.
meanings.sent3: The plan to have a picnic may miscarries if it rains all day.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to fix the broken toy may miscarries if he doesn't have the right tools.
meanings.sent5: The team's hope for victory may miscarries if they don't work together.

meanings.definition: Suffer a miscarriage, especially in terms of pregnancy.
meanings.sent1: She was devastated when she miscarries during her pregnancy.
meanings.sent2: It is important for pregnant women to take care of their health to avoid miscarries.
meanings.sent3: The expecting couple was heartbroken when they miscarries their first child.
meanings.sent4: The doctor advised her to rest to prevent a possible miscarries.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to support the family after the tragic miscarries.

meanings.sent1: The hiker feared that he might miscarries in the dense forest.
meanings.sent2: Without a map, it's easy to miscarries while hiking in unfamiliar terrain.
meanings.sent3: The package may miscarries if it's not properly labeled for delivery.
meanings.sent4: The letter could miscarries in the mail if the address is incorrect.
meanings.sent5: The key might miscarries if it falls into the deep ocean.
